title: U.S. Expands Boat Strikes to Pacific, and Trump Tears Down East Wing
summary: Plus, the island that just got its first mosquitoes.

title: Trump Is Wasting No Time in Tearing Down the East Wing
summary: President Trump initially said the ballroom construction would not dismantle parts of the White House. His officials now say it is cheaper and more structurally sound to simply demolish the East Wing.

title: What to Know About the White House East Wing and Its History
summary: The East Wing has been a base for the first lady, an entryway for social functions and an emergency bunker.

title: The White House Wrecking Ball
summary: President Trump’s demolition of the East Wing has struck a nerve in Washington and beyond.

title: Cuomo Joins Adams at Knicks Game. Is an Endorsement in the Cards?
summary: Former Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo and Mayor Eric Adams looked like the best of friends as they sat together at Madison Square Garden right after the debate.

title: 7 Takeaways From the Final N.Y.C. Mayoral Debate
summary: Zohran Mamdani, Andrew M. Cuomo and Curtis Sliwa continued attacking one another, with Mr. Mamdani and Mr. Cuomo the main targets.

title: N.Y.C. Mayoral Candidates Trade Zingers in Final Debate
summary: The candidates sparred over their policies, personalities and how they would deal with President Trump in the second and final debate of the mayoral campaign.

title: Harvard Records an Increase in Asian Students and a Drop in Black Students
summary: The shift mirrors trends at other elite schools after a ban on affirmative action. The Trump administration has said it wants to scrutinize demographics to ensure schools aren’t using racial preferences.

title: A Costly Radio System Faltered When Texas Needed It Most
summary: Motorola won a $7 million contract to modernize Kerr County’s emergency radio system. When a devastating flash flood swept through the county, emergency crews had trouble using it.

title: Drug-Smuggling Submarines on Display at Latin American Naval Base
summary: A display of confiscated vessels at a naval base in Ecuador offers a peek at why drug smuggling is so hard to stop.

title: U.S. Strikes 2nd Boat in Pacific as Antidrug Operation Expands
summary: The Trump administration announced a second strike outside the Caribbean, in a campaign against what U.S. officials say are boats carrying drugs bound for the United States.

title: How Europe Is Trying to Turn Frozen Russian Assets Into Cash for Ukraine
summary: European Union officials could reach a political agreement as soon as Thursday on a plan for a huge loan to Ukraine backed by Kremlin money frozen in a Belgian financial institution.

title: Trump Imposes Sanctions on Russian Oil Companies as His Frustration With Putin Mounts
summary: The sanctions are among the most significant measures that the United States has taken against the Russian energy sector since the beginning of the war in Ukraine.

title: Oil Price Jumps on Trump’s Russia Sanctions
summary: Traders are pondering whether the United States and its allies are finally getting serious about restricting Russian energy.

title: Russians Awake to Trump’s New Oil Sanctions and Largely Shrug
summary: While oil markets reacted strongly to the sanctions, analysts said the measures were unlikely to significantly change President Vladimir V. Putin’s war calculations.

title: As Shutdown Drags and Trump Flexes, Congress Cedes Its Relevance
summary: “It’s like we have given up,” one Republican lawmaker said.

title: Financial Assistance Options for Federal Employees During the Government Shutdown
summary: Some banks are offering a pause on payments on certain loans, waiving late fees and providing no-interest loans.

title: At a Mass Burial in Gaza, Palestinians Mourn the Unknown Dead
summary: Under the terms of a cease-fire deal, Israel and Hamas have been exchanging remains, but Gaza’s medical authorities have not been able to identify many of them.

title: U.S. May Seek United Nations Mandate for Gaza Security Force, Rubio Says
summary: Before boarding a plane for Israel, Secretary of State Marco Rubio said that U.N. backing was a potential next step to deploying an international stabilization force to the war-torn enclave.

title: In “Life, Part 2,” Leslie Jones Wants to Make Everybody Laugh
summary: Though the comedian got a late start to fame, her third special, “Life Part 2,” continues a decade-long streak crafting a career that appeals to the masses.

title: Can a Beach Really Be Evil? Ask the Sun-Seekers in Good Sahel.
summary: The sea looks the same. So does the sand. But in Egypt, two beach communities not far from each other have decidedly different ideas about fun.

title: Chinese Impersonator’s Trump Act Has Won Him Millions of Fans
summary: Ryan Chen has turned an uncanny impersonation of President Trump into a social media career, and a mirror of China’s fascination with America.

title: Fear and Anger Fill New York’s Canal Street After Immigration Raid
summary: The famous shopping strip, usually teeming with street vendors, turned quiet a day after federal agents descended.

title: Pelosi Says Police May Arrest Federal Agents Who Violate California Law
summary: The San Francisco district attorney said in an interview that she came up with the strategy after seeing federal agents repeatedly roughing up people in Los Angeles and Chicago.

title: Newsom Says Benioff Is Still ‘Family’ Despite the National Guard Remarks
summary: Gov. Gavin Newsom has a long relationship with Marc Benioff, the chief executive of Salesforce, that dates back to a different era in San Francisco.

title: Trump Has a Religion. What Do Democrats Have?
summary: Mamdani might be working in Democrats’ favor. But what about “No Kings”?

title: The Democratic Party Is Getting Too Rich to Win
summary: Democrats used to be known as the party of the poor and the working class. Two decades of federal income data show how that changed.

title: The Abdication of Congress
summary: We explain what elected officials aren’t doing during the government shutdown.

title: Late Night Responds to Trump’s Justice Department Query
summary: The “Daily Show” host Michael Kosta said the president seeking compensation shouldn’t be a surprise: “Trump sues people more often than Barron gets hit by a sea gull.”

title: King Charles and Pope Leo Pray Together in Groundbreaking Moment
summary: It was the first time in hundreds of years that the leaders of the Catholic and Anglican churches prayed together, offering a public display of unity between Christian faiths.

title: Broadway Averts Strike as Musicians Reach Deal With Producers, Union Says
summary: The tentative agreement, which still requires ratification by union members, comes five days after a similar agreement with actors and stage managers.

title: Nepal’s Gen Z Sees Little Hope at Home
summary: The protests that rocked Nepal were about more than a social media ban. The economy is so dire that for many, going abroad seems the only way to build a future.

title: Drug With a 30-Year Monopoly Is Target of State-Level Push to Curb Prices
summary: In a first, Colorado will cap the price of Enbrel, an arthritis drug. Using patent tactics, the drugmaker Amgen has aggressively blocked competition for it.
